key_points: Facebook, Instagram, Messenger, and WhatsApp experienced outages for some users.
Users began reporting issues around 2 p.m. ET, according to DownDetector.com.
Meta acknowledged the problem, stating work was underway to resolve the issues.
The outage affected Messenger, Workplace Chat, and Instagram DMs.
Services were largely restored by approximately 6 p.m. ET.
Meta apologized for the inconvenience, confirming the issue was fixed by 7:20 p.m. ET.
This outage follows one of the longest in the company's history, which occurred a month prior.
The incident comes amid ongoing fallout from whistleblower Frances Haugen's leaked documents.
Social media users used Twitter to discuss the outage, making #instagramdown a trending topic.
Some users also poked fun at Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg during the outage.
